info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 10:44PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cabarrus, southeastern Lincoln, Mecklenburg, south central Rowan, Gaston, northeastern Union and northeastern York Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1044 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of Kannapolis to near Gastonia. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Uptown Charlotte, Huntersville, Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte and East Charlotte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
